column2: NORTH DAKOTA DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This road sign tells drivers that:
column4: the one-way street or roadway ahead ends.
column8: they must turn either to the right or left.

column2: 2. You may pass another vehicle:
column4: on the shoulder of the highway.
column6: when there is a solid yellow line on your side.
column8: on a curve or a hill.

column2: 3. It is important for drivers to know that trucks:
column4: are easier for the driver to operate.
column6: take longer than cars to stop.
column8: require more space for turning movements.
column10: require less time to pass on an incline than cars.

column2: 4. Drivers must be prepared for anything coming up in the road ahead. They should:
column4: stare straight ahead at all times.
column6: drive with the right foot resting lightly on the brake pedal.
column8: maintain focus toward the left of the road.
column10: scan the road for traffic conditions and possible hazards.

column2: 5. When the pavement is marked with a double yellow line, drivers may pass other vehicles:
column6: only if the vehicle ahead is driving 10 mph or more under the speed limit.
column8: only if there are no oncoming vehicles.
column10: None of the other answers is correct.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column4: Vehicles turning left must make a U-turn.
column6: Left turns are not allowed where this sign is displayed.
column8: Sharp turn ahead.
column10: Drivers cannot make a complete turn to go in the opposite direction.

column2: 7. If your vehicle’s right wheels leave the pavement, you should:
column4: maintain your current speed to gain better traction.
column6: immediately come to a complete stop.
column8: take your foot off the gas and when you are slowed down, ease back on the road when it is safe to do so.
column10: build up brake pressure by pumping the brake pedal several times.

column2: 8. This sign indicates:
column6: Do not use your phone while driving
column8: Cell phone shop ahead

column2: 9. When changing lanes on a highway, drivers should:
column6: check the rearview and outside mirrors.
column8: glance over their shoulder to check their blind spots.

column2: 10. The effects of alcohol on driving do NOT include:
column8: Better concentration

column2: 11. When you see this sign you should:
column4: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.
column6: prepare to slow down and possibly yield to oncoming traffic.
column8: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.
column10: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.

column2: 12. When in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:
column4: acceptable to drink alcoholic beverages if you are not driving.
column6: illegal to possess an open container of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column8: permissible to drink a moderate amount of alcohol when driving with a passenger.
column10: illegal to drink from, but permissible to transport, open containers of alcohol in the passenger compartment.

column2: 13. From top to bottom, traffic lights are:
column8: red, green and yellow.

column2: 14. A red flashing signal means the same as a:
column8: caution sign.

column2: 15. Look over your shoulder to check your blind spot:
column6: on all right and left turns.
column8: when pulling to the right side of the road or away from a curb.

column2: 16. When other vehicles are approaching an uncontrolled intersection at approximately the same time, you should:
column4: maintain your speed and proceed through the intersection.
column6: watch for vehicles coming from the right and yield the right-of-way, then proceed when safe.
column8: increase your speed and get through the intersection.
column10: come to a complete stop and wait until there are no vehicles at the intersection.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column8: Pavement is narrowing

column2: 18. Never make a U-turn from:
column8: the left part of the lane nearest to the centerline of the roadway.

column2: 19. This road sign means:
column8: Side road

column2: 20. When driving on slippery roads, drivers should:
column8: increase their following distance.

column2: 21. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column8: yield to other pedestrians.
column10: go back and wait the “WALK” light

column2: 22. When they approach this sign, drivers must:
column4: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.
column8: obey signals from crossing guards.

column2: 23. The amount of space you need to cross traffic depends on the:
column4: road and weather conditions and oncoming traffic.
column8: number of cars in front of you.

column2: 24. Keeping a space cushion between you and the other vehicles around you is important because it:
column6: gives you time to react to situations.
column8: keeps other drivers alert.
column10: keeps traffic flowing at a safe pace.

column2: 25. What is the meaning of blue traffic signs?
column4: A blue background indicates a regulatory sign.
column8: Blue indicates road user services.
column10: Blue indicates pedestrian crossings and school zones.
